alert.note: Alert for Chaves; Roosevelt (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 8:42PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in east central New Mexico, Roosevelt. In southeast New Mexico, Chaves. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 841 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving slowly south and southwest along the U.S. Highway 70 corridor between Elida and Roswell. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen over parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elida, Kenna, Elkins and Milnesand. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
